availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Maurice Power (Louisville, Kentucky, merchant and bookkeeper)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, merchant and bookkeeper. Native of Ireland. Father of Francis Power, Mary Power, and Kate Power. Married to Nancy Ann Willoughby Power in Louisville, Kentucky, on January 11, 1862. Bookkeeper in Louisville in 1858. Merchant in Louisville in 1860. Coal merchant in Louisville in 1861. Bookkeeper in Louisville in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 6, p. 228.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482709.
"Coal---Coal---Coal" The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), January 18, 1861, p. 2.
Louisville City Directory and Business Mirror for 1858-9, (Louisville: Hurd & Burrows, 1859), 139.
Edwards' Annual Director to the Inhabitants, Institutions, Incorporated Companies, Manufacturing Establishments, Business firms, Etc., Etc., in the City of Louisville, For 1865-6 (Louisville: Edwards, Greenough & Deved, 1866), 482.
